General Motors Tetap Berikan Layanan Purna Jual di Indonesia
04 Nov 2019, 00:59 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - General Motors (GM) Indonesia memastikan kepada pelanggan setianya akan tetap hadir dan eksis dalam memberikan layanan purna jual. Hal ini merupakan komitmen yang diberikan oleh GM Indonesia setelah pengumumannya untuk menghentikan penjualan kendaraan-kendaraan baru pada akhir Maret 2020 mendatang.
Setelah Maret 2020 mendatang, layanan purna jual dan aftersales akan tetap berada di bawah naungan GM Indonesia. Hal ini merupakan bentuk nyata komitmen GM Indonesia untuk tetap hadir dan melayani pelanggan di pasar Indonesia dan tetap memberikan layanan purna jual yang terbaik kepada pelanggan dan pemilik kendaraan Chevrolet.
GM Indonesia akan memastikan kelangsungan kebutuhan layanan purna jual dan suku cadang kepada para pelanggan setianya dengan terus bekerja sama authorized service outlet (ASO) di seluruh Indonesia.
Para pelanggan dan pemilik kendaraan Chevrolet Indonesia dapat mengunjungi layanan authorized service outlet (ASO) untuk melakukan pengecekan rutin kendaraan, perawatan, perbaikan, pembelian fast-moving spare parts, beserta layanan warranty.
Customer Care and Aftersales Service Director GM Indonesia, Dadan Ramadhani, menyampaikan kepada para pelanggan dan pemilik kendaraan Chevrolet agar tidak perlu khawatir mengenai layanan purna jual Chevrolet.
“General Motors Indonesia masih eksis untuk memberikan layanan warranty dan purna jual. Kami akan tetap setia melayani setiap pelanggan untuk perawatan dan perbaikan kendaraan Chevrolet mereka di outlet resmi kami di seluruh Indonesia. Kami juga akan terus bekerjasama dengan seluruh jaringan dealer untuk mendukung kelancaran peralihan dan persiapan purna jual,” ujar Dadan dalam keterangan resmi yang diterima Tempo, Minggu, 3 November 2019.

General Motors Still Provides After Sales Service in Indonesia
04 Nov 2019, 00:59 by Tempo.co, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - General Motors (GM) Indonesia ensures that loyal customers will remain present and exist in providing after sales service. This is a commitment given by GM Indonesia after its announcement to stop selling new vehicles by the end of March 2020.
After March 2020, after-sales service and aftersales will remain under the auspices of GM Indonesia. This is a tangible form of GM Indonesia's commitment to remain present and serve customers in the Indonesian market and continue to provide the best after-sales service to customers and owners of Chevrolet vehicles.
GM Indonesia will ensure the continued needs of after-sales service and spare parts to its loyal customers by continuing to work with authorized service outlets (ASO) throughout Indonesia.
Customers and owners of Chevrolet Indonesia vehicles can visit the authorized service outlet (ASO) service to carry out routine vehicle checks, maintenance, repairs, purchase of fast-moving spare parts, as well as warranty services.
GM Indonesia Customer Care and Aftersales Service Director, Dadan Ramadhani, told customers and owners of Chevrolet vehicles to not have to worry about Chevrolet's after-sales services.
"General Motors Indonesia still exists to provide warranty and after-sales services. We will continue to faithfully serve every customer for the maintenance and repair of their Chevrolet vehicles at our official outlets throughout Indonesia. We will also continue to work with the entire dealer network to support the smooth transition and after-sales preparation, "Dadan said in an official statement received by Tempo, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
